title: 'Very warm conversation': PM Modi speaks with Donald Trump; trade, defence in focus
content: Prime Minister Modi and President Trump held a productive call, reviewing the robust India-US Comprehensive Global Strategic Partnership. Both leaders expressed satisfaction with growing bilateral cooperation and discussed enhancing trade, critical technologies, energy, and defense. They also committed to collaborating on regional and global issues, reinforcing their commitment to a deepening strategic alliance.

title: Delhi riots case: Umar Khalid gets interim bail; why court gave relief
content: A Delhi court has granted interim bail to former JNU student leader Umar Khalid from December 16 to 29. This temporary relief allows him to attend his sister's wedding. Khalid, arrested under UAPA in the Delhi riots conspiracy case, will return to custody after the permitted period.

title: No relief for Goa club owners: Court denies interim bail; Thailand to deport Luthras soon
content: Delhi court denied transit anticipatory bail to Saurabh and Gaurav Luthras, owners of the Goa nightclub where a fatal fire occurred. The brothers sought protection to avoid immediate arrest upon returning from Thailand. Goa's counsel argued they were evading legal process, while the defense emphasized their willingness to cooperate with the investigation.

title: US to help Pak upgrade its F-16s: Trump admin clears $686m deal; a message for India?
content: The Trump administration has notified Congress of a $686 million package to modernise Pakistan's F-16 fleet, including avionics upgrades and tactical data links. This move, aimed at enhancing interoperability for counterterrorism, comes amid strained US-India ties and follows Pakistan's recent diplomatic efforts with Washington.

title: Another Google founder beats Amazon founder Jeff Bezos in World's Richest ranking
content: Sergey Brin, a Google founder, has surpassed Jeff Bezos of Amazon on the global rich list. Brin's wealth now stands at $240 billion, just ahead of Bezos at $239.9 billion. This shift is driven by a surge in Alphabet's stock. Google's AI advancements, particularly its Gemini model, are fueling this growth.

title: Truck falls into gorge: 22 feared dead; authorities alerted when survivor emerges after 72hrs
content: Tragedy struck in Arunachal Pradesh as at least 22 Assam labourers are feared dead after their mini truck plunged into a deep gorge near the Indo-China border. A lone survivor, severely injured, alerted authorities after a perilous journey. Rescue operations are underway, with specialized teams and the Army working to retrieve bodies from the treacherous terrain.

title: New regional axis? B'desh hints willing to join bloc that excludes India; backs Pak's plan
content: Bangladesh's foreign affairs adviser stated it's strategically possible for Dhaka to join a regional grouping with Pakistan, excluding India, following Islamabad's signals for a trilateral initiative with China. He also noted progress on lifting US sanctions on RAB and dismissed the likelihood of further sanctions on Bangladeshi leaders.

title: Just Rs 100: ICC opens T20 World Cup ticket sales; prices set at 'historic low'
content: Ticket sales for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 have opened with entry-level prices starting at Rs 100 in India and LKR 1,000 in Sri Lanka. Co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka, the tournament aims for unprecedented accessibility with over 2 million tickets available. The event will feature 20 teams playing 55 matches across eight venues.

title: How Nvidia CEO's for America's 'China chip problem' may not actually work
content: Nvidia's new location verification software for AI chips faces a critical flaw: it's optional for customers. This voluntary system, meant to prevent advanced chips from reaching restricted nations, relies on smugglers to install monitoring tools, a paradoxical approach.  The software, designed for fleet management, lacks enforcement, raising doubts about its effectiveness against illicit chip diversion.

title: ‚ÄòBirth tourism‚Äô under scrutiny: US warns tourist visas will be rejected if purpose is to give birth
content: US consular officers will now reject tourist visa applications if the primary purpose of travel is to give birth in the country for the child's US citizenship. Officials stated such travel is not permitted and will lead to visa denial, as part of a broader policy to curb birth tourism.

title: Uttar Pradesh: Fake, drunk doc performs surgery watching YouTube; woman dies
content: A woman died in Barabanki after an illegal clinic owner and his nephew allegedly performed surgery on her while watching a YouTube video. The clinic operator, described as a 'quack', reportedly operated under the influence of alcohol, leading to a fatal incision. A case has been registered, and efforts are underway to apprehend the absconding accused.

title: Trump's $1m Gold card: What it means for Indians, EB-5 visa aspirants; what you should know
content: US President Donald Trump has launched a new Gold Card program, requiring a $1 million donation for individuals or $2 million for corporations to gain legal status and a path to citizenship. This initiative aims to attract exceptional talent and generate government revenue, presenting an alternative to the EB-5 visa system.

title: What 'luxury shopping order' of Netflix TV series director accused of fraud said
content: Netflix director Carl Rinsch faces a fraud trial for allegedly misusing $11 million production funds. Prosecutors claim he spent lavishly on personal items, including a $439,000 mattress and designer goods, comparing his situation to 'Brewster's Millions.'  His former assistant testified about extravagant purchases and luxury car usage.

title: 2nd T20I: 2011 WC hero joins India's huddle in Mullanpur; pics go viral
content: Cricket legend Yuvraj Singh energised Team India's pre-match moments ahead of the second T20I against South Africa. Following a dominant 101-run victory in the opener, where Hardik Pandya starred with an all-round performance and Jasprit Bumrah reached 100 T20I wickets, the squad received a motivational boost. Yuvraj's presence aims to sustain India's winning momentum in Mullanpur.

title: Mass visa chaos: H-1B families stranded in India; US consulates cancel interviews
content: Hundreds of Indian H-1B visa holders and their families are stranded in India due to a new US Department of State policy mandating social-media screening. This has led to mass cancellations and rescheduling of visa appointments, pushing many into 2026, jeopardizing jobs and disrupting family lives.

title: CBI cracks Rs 1000cr crypto scam: 2 Chinese nationals, 150 shell accounts exposed
content: CBI has charged 30 individuals, including two Chinese nationals, in a massive Rs 1,000-crore crypto-investment scam.  The accused allegedly used a fake app, 'HPZ Tokens', to dupe investors with promises of huge returns on non-existent bitcoin-mining machines.  This sophisticated cyber-crime network, operated from abroad, exploited India's payment aggregation system to launder funds.

title: Paige Shiver‚Äôs net worth: 55% salary hike and link to Sherrone Moore scandal fuel speculation
content: University of Michigan football is in turmoil as executive assistant Paige Shiver faces intense public scrutiny. Her name is linked to former coach Sherrone Moore's firing and police detainment due to alleged inappropriate relationship rumors. Shiver's recent significant salary increase and social media silence have fueled speculation amid the ongoing investigation.

title: Candace Owens hits back as Erika Kirk urges public to stop Charlie Kirk rumors
content: Erika Kirk pleaded for privacy regarding her husband Charlie Kirk's burial site on Fox News, citing fears of grave desecration. However, Candace Owens interpreted this plea as a veiled attack, claiming Kirk's words were directed at her. Owens continues to promote unverified theories about Kirk's assassination, despite official reports pointing to a lone gunman.

title: Venus Williams & Andrea Preti net worth 2025: Career, family & business
content: Venus Williams boasts an estimated $95 million net worth in 2025, primarily from her legendary tennis career and successful fashion and design businesses. Her partner, Andrea Preti, an actor and businessman, contributes an estimated $1-2 million. Together, their combined net worth is approximately $96-97 million, reflecting their individual financial achievements.

title: Split coaching: Ex-captain responds after Gambhir's 'stick to domain' remark
content: Kapil Dev dismissed the idea of split coaches for Indian cricket following their Test series loss to South Africa. He emphasized that the BCCI should adopt the system best suited for Indian cricket. Dev also commented on the unchanging nature of sporting challenges and player priorities regarding T20 leagues versus national duty.

title: Stefon Diggs reacts to Cardi B‚Äôs bold green bob and leather look on Miami night out
content: Cardi B and Stefon Diggs are solidifying their status as a prominent NFL power couple, recently showcasing their public affection during a Miami girls' night. Diggs' viral comment on Cardi's vibrant green bob and stylish outfit highlighted their growing comfort in sharing intimate moments online, reinforcing their strong connection amid recent celebrations and new beginnings.

title: ODI series win: Ex-KKR teammate asks why Gambhir did not 'credit' Rohit, Virat - 'Felt strange'
content: Former India batter Robin Uthappa expressed surprise at head coach Gautam Gambhir not mentioning Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's stellar performances after India's ODI series win.  Despite their significant contributions, Uthappa found Gambhir's silence unusual, especially given the senior players' consistent form. He added that both senior players delivered strong performances.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Luthra brothers misled police - what cops told court
content: Goa police informed a Delhi court that nightclub co-owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra misled investigators and showed no cooperation after the deadly fire that killed 25. The brothers, who fled to Thailand, are seeking anticipatory bail, but police argue their actions disentitle them to such protection. The investigation into the blaze continues.

title: Chaos in Pakistan: Punches, kicks fly; referee assaulted - Watch
content: Chaos erupted after a National Games football semi-final in Karachi, with Pakistan Army and WAPDA players and officials involved in a violent brawl.  The altercation, captured on live broadcast and social media, saw punches and kicks exchanged.  Frustration over a penalty kick reportedly fueled the post-match aggression, leading to injuries and a pursuit of the referee.

title: Sex, lies, video: How 100-member spy-cam gang targeted Delhi cops
content: A sophisticated crime syndicate in Delhi used hidden cameras in commercial vehicles to record traffic police, then doctored footage for blackmail and extortion. The gang, led by Raju Meena and Jeeshan Ali, also lodged false corruption complaints against targeted officers and even demanded sexual favors from female personnel, causing significant distress and forcing transfers.

title: Goa fire fallout: Thailand treaty & how Luthras will be sent back ‚Äî deportation playbook
content: Co-owners of the 'Birch by Romeo Lane' nightclub, Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, are set to be extradited to India from Thailand after fleeing following a fire that claimed 25 lives. Detained in Phuket, their extradition highlights the India-Thailand Extradition Treaty, which facilitates the surrender of fugitive offenders.

title: Kolhapuri chappal row: Prada to team up with Indian artisans; launch limited-edition sandals
content: Prada is collaborating with Indian artisans for a limited-edition sandal collection, following criticism for designs resembling traditional Kolhapuri chappals.  The luxury brand will produce 2,000 pairs in Maharashtra and Karnataka, blending Indian craftsmanship with Italian techniques. This initiative aims to elevate global recognition for the craft and ensure fair compensation for artisans.

title: 'Under pressure, hands trembling': Rahul takes dig at Shah over Lok Sabha speech ‚Äî watch
content: Rahul Gandhi accused Home Minister Amit Shah of appearing nervous and using foul language during his Lok Sabha speech on electoral reforms. Gandhi challenged Shah to a debate on his press conference allegations, but Shah stated Parliament would not function according to Gandhi's wishes.

title: IGPL tour: Pranavi creates history; first Indian woman to win professional golf title against men
content: Pranavi Urs made history at the IGPL Invitational Mumbai, becoming the first Indian woman to win a professional golf event in an open field against men. Shooting a bogey-free 8-under 60, she overtook overnight leader Karandeep Kochhar to claim the title. Her breakthrough highlights the growing strength of women‚Äôs golf in India and challenges longstanding gender norms in sport.

title: IND vs SA: 'He's scared of Yuvraj' - The tough-love mentorship behind Abhishek Sharma's rise
content: Abhishek Sharma's rapid rise to international cricket is attributed to his rigorous childhood training and the strict mentorship of Yuvraj Singh. His father and coaches recall his dedication from a young age, with Yuvraj's tough love continuing to shape his game, even influencing his adoption of golf to refine his batting.

title: Skydiver left hanging from plane tail; video shows dramatic escape ‚Äî watch
content: A terrifying mid-air ordeal unfolded for an Australian skydiver when their reserve parachute snagged on a plane's tail during a formation jump.  Dangling thousands of feet above ground, the skydiver ingeniously used a hook knife to free themselves before safely deploying their main parachute. The incident also impacted the aircraft, causing damage and a mayday call.

title: Exclusive: 'Bowling fast helps me pay my rent' - Lockie Ferguson
content: Desert Vipers skipper Lockie Ferguson reflects on the ILT20‚Äôs rapid growth and the value it brings to the UAE and Associate players. He discusses New Zealand‚Äôs sporting culture, the realities of injury setbacks, and why fast bowlers form a unique global brotherhood. Ferguson also addresses the challenge of flat pitches, evolving T20 skills, and the constant pursuit of pace.

title: Bombay HC directs Shilpa-Raj to deposit Rs 60 crore to lift LOC
content: Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra must deposit Rs 60 crore or provide a bank guarantee to lift the Lookout Circular. The couple seeks to travel to London to attend to Kundra's ailing father, who is reportedly suffering from a severe medical condition. They are contesting a cheating case filed by a complainant alleging a Rs 60 crore investment was misused.

title: ICG detains 11 Pakistani fishermen: Vessel caught operating illegally near Gujarat
content: The Indian Coast Guard apprehended a Pakistani fishing boat with 11 crew members for illegally operating within Indian waters. This decisive action underscores India's commitment to protecting its maritime frontiers and upholding international maritime law. The operation highlights the Coast Guard's sustained vigilance and proactive approach to national maritime security.

title: Pakistan ex-ISI chief jailed: Faiz Hameed handed 14 years in prison
content: Former ISI director general Lt Gen (retd) Faiz Hameed has been sentenced to 14 years in prison by a Pakistani military court. The court-martial found him guilty of political interference, misuse of authority, and violating the official secrets act. This rare conviction of a high-ranking former military official signals the military leadership's stance against political involvement by officers.

title: Tariff war: After US, Mexico imposes up to 50% duties on India ‚Äî which sector hit hardest?
content: Mexico has approved significant tariff hikes, up to 50%, on imports from India, China, and other Asian nations starting in 2026 to protect its domestic industry. The move, affecting around 1,400 product lines including auto parts and vehicles, aims to boost local manufacturing and jobs, though it faces opposition from affected countries and business groups.

title: Inside Tirumala dupatta 'scandal': How fake ‚Äòsilk‚Äô entered VIP rituals; probe zeroes in on suppliers
content: Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams faces a new scam. A supplier allegedly sold polyester dupattas as pure silk for ten years. This fraud, involving crores, comes after a previous laddu adulteration row. The TTD has ordered an Anti-Corruption Bureau probe. The dupattas are presented to donors and VIPs, making this a breach of trust and devotional sentiment.

title: ‚ÄòIt is a gift‚Äô: Trump pitches ‚ÄòGold Card‚Äô as boost for India, China students
content: US President Donald Trump announced the new Gold Card Visa program, aiming to retain highly skilled foreign graduates from top American universities, including Indians. This initiative seeks to address the dilemma companies face in hiring talented individuals who might otherwise be forced to leave the country, despite broader immigration crackdowns.

title: Rupee hits new record low: Currency weakens to 90.46 versus US dollar; RBI likely intervened to stem fall
content: The Indian rupee hit a new low against the US dollar, breaching the 90 mark again due to trade deal challenges and corporate demand.  Despite a weakening dollar globally, the rupee has fallen over 5% this year.

title: Dhurandhar box office collection day 7: Ranveer starrer inches towards Rs 190cr
content: Aditya Dhar's directorial 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has become a major box office hit, garnering positive reviews and strong audience acceptance. The film demonstrated impressive weekday stability, maintaining collections in the Rs. 20 crore range and is expected to cross Rs 200 crore soon.

title: ‚ÄòE-cigarettes allowed?‚Äô: BJP MP questions Om Birla; alleges TMC MPs smoked inside Parl
content: BJP MP Anurag Thakur accused TMC MPs of vaping e-cigarettes in Lok Sabha, prompting Speaker Om Birla to state that no permission was granted and strict action would be taken if confirmed. The Speaker urged members to maintain decorum and assured action upon a formal written complaint.

title: US seizes Venezuela oil tanker: How did the ship manage to keep its location hidden?
content: US forces have seized an oil tanker, reportedly named the Skipper, off Venezuela's coast.  Satellite imagery and photos reveal the vessel may have faked its location, broadcasting false data while offloading oil.  The tanker has a history of transporting sanctioned oil from Iran and Venezuela, with millions of barrels moved previously. Venezuela has denounced the seizure as piracy.

title: Peaky Blinders fan? Not in Afghanistan ‚Äî 4 arrested over fashion outfits
content: Four 'Peaky Blinders' fans in Afghanistan were detained by the Taliban for adopting a style deemed "in conflict with Afghan values." Officials stated the men were summoned after dressing in outfits inspired by the TV series, which the Taliban viewed as promoting foreign culture. They were released after a rehabilitation program aimed at correcting their behavior.

title: 'I was very bored': Arshdeep Singh reveals when he decided to become a YouTuber
content: Indian pacer Arshdeep Singh revealed his YouTube channel's origin stemmed from frustration after being dropped for the Champions Trophy 2025 opener. Instead of dwelling on disappointment, he embraced the downtime, finding positivity and a creative outlet. His relatable humor, exemplified by a viral reel with Virat Kohli, has captivated fans, turning setbacks into opportunities.

title: Fired Moore in custody, suspect in alleged assault
content: Sherrone Moore was in custody Wednesday night as a suspect in an alleged assault, just hours after he was fired as Michigan's football coach for having what the school said was an "inappropriate relationship with a staff member."

title: Lakers swat away playoff talk, focus on reeling D
content: LeBron James and the Lakers agreed it's too early to discuss how far the Lakers can go in the postseason, especially after the Spurs exposed their already suspect perimeter defense Wednesday to eliminate L.A. from the NBA Cup.

title: Suns' Allen ejected after shoving OKC's Holmgren
content: Suns guard Grayson Allen was ejected from an NBA Cup quarterfinal game against Oklahoma City on Wednesday night after he shoved Thunder center Chet Holmgren and knocked him to the floor.

title: OKC rolls again, ties 73-win Dubs with 24-1 start
content: The Thunder punched their ticket to Las Vegas with a 49-point blowout of the Suns in Wednesday's NBA Cup quarterfinals, matching the 2015-16 Warriors for the best 25-game start in NBA history at 24-1.

title: Crooks: 11-0 ISU 'battle-tested' after win vs. Iowa
content: Audi Crooks had another huge game in leading No. 10 Iowa State past in-state rival and No. 11 Iowa on Wednesday. After the win, which kept the Cyclones undefeated at 11-0, Crooks said, "I feel like now we're officially battle-tested."

title: Man Utd hits record $1B debt with summer spend
content: Manchester United's net debt has broken the $1 billion barrier for the first time due to summer borrowings for player recruitment.

title: Sources: NWSL voting on extra funds to pay stars
content: The NWSL's Board of Governors is in advanced discussions about implementing a new roster mechanism that would allow each team to pay star players significant salaries beyond the current salary cap, multiple sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Curry (thigh) expected to return Fri. vs. Wolves
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry, who has missed the past five games because of a bruised thigh, is expected to return Friday against the Wolves.

title: üèà How Colts signed Philip Rivers out of retirement
content: Philip Rivers hasn't taken a snap since 2020, but he might be about to enter a playoff race against elite defenses.

title: Everything to know from Thunder and Spurs advancing to Las Vegas
content: The top moments, highlights and takeaways as the Thunder and Spurs won their respective games to advance to Las Vegas.

title: The NFL's best player through 14 games is ...? Barnwell stacks 15 MVP candidates and picks the winner
content: Let's make the MVP cases for 15 players -- including a ranking of the top five. Can anyone catch Matthew Stafford or Drake Maye?

title: Fowler and Graziano: Buzz on Daniel Jones, falling contenders and head coach candidates
content: What effect will Jones' injury have on the offseason QB market? Here's the latest intel heading into Week 15.

title: MLB winter meetings winners, losers and head-scratching moves
content: Now that the dust has settled in Orlando, we debate our favorite (and least favorite) moves of the week -- and what's ahead this offseason.

title: What to make of the Mets losing Pete Alonso, Edwin Diaz on back-to-back days
content: Losing two faces of the franchise to free agency might feel like a gut punch, but is it a disaster for the Mets?

title: Five Anthony Davis trades, including a chaotic five-team blockbuster
content: With AD trade buzz ramping up, our experts propose five deals that could shift the league's balance of power.

title: Everything Shams is hearing on NBA trade season: Where could Davis land?
content: The futures of Anthony Davis and Giannis Antetokounmpo are in focus. Here's everything we're hearing.

title: How a 28-year-old Chris Weinke became one of the most unlikely Heisman winners ever
content: After leaving pro baseball, the quarterback ignited a debate about whether his age was helping him tear up college football.

title: NHL trade tiers big board: Which players could be on the move this season?
content: Here's a way-too-early look at the shocking superstar possibilities, pending free agents and overlooked gems.

title: Jason Collins, on his cancer diagnosis: It's Stage 4 glioblastoma and I'm fighting
content: In an exclusive with ESPN, the 13-year NBA veteran and pioneer reveals that he is fighting for his life.

title: A trade for the No. 1 pick?! Let's project next year's first round in Yates' updated NFL mock draft
content: Which teams need a quarterback? Could Ohio State dominate the first round? Field Yates projects the opening 32 picks of next year's draft.

title: Wetzel: Beware, college sports, private equity has arrived
content: The University of Utah approved a groundbreaking private equity deal. Dan Wetzel writes that big changes could follow.

title: For Nebraska's Dani Busboom Kelly, home is where you hang a banner
content: Replacing legendary coach and mentor John Cook was just a step on her path to building a legend of her own.

title: Pulisic's form and fitness make him undroppable for the USMNT at 2026 World Cup
content: Christian Pulisic is Serie A's leading scorer, despite playing only 446 minutes. The U.S. can't afford to leave that kind of player on the bench.

title: UCL talking points: Liverpool better without Salah? Will Alonso be sacked?
content: Have Liverpool found a blueprint for life without Mo Salah? How long will Xabi Alonso be given at Madrid? ESPN's experts answer all the burning questions from UCL Matchday 6.

title: UWCL talking points: Chelsea eye top 4, what's happened to PSG?
content: Emily Keogh, Yash Thakur and Sam Marsden answer some of our burning questions after the fifth round of the UEFA Women's Champions League action.

title: The hope and heroism of Army safety Larry Pickett Jr.
content: In August, Pickett Jr. and his family came upon a terrifying scene: power lines down, a car on fire and a man close to death.

title: Bench Justin Jefferson? Three stars to consider sitting, three others to start
content: Underperforming stars managers shouldn't be afraid to bench and ascending players to green light this week.

title: Chris Paul's 'get-better mentality' paved the way for OKC's dominance
content: Paul spent only one season in OKC but left a lasting impression on reigning MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.

title: NBA Power Rankings: What is each team's biggest weakness?
content: NBA insiders break down the latest Power Rankings, evaluating all 30 teams as the Emirates NBA Cup heats up.

title: Power Rankings: The 4-team race for No. 1
content: Arizona, Duke, Michigan and Iowa State each have legitimate cases to top this week's edition. Which prevailed?

title: 5 early lessons of men's basketball season: Real vs. pretend contenders, more
content: Michigan is better than expected. Kentucky is worse. And Duke headlines an ACC that looks as if it's "back."

title: Predicting the top 5 picks in the 2026 MLB draft after White Sox win lottery
content: With Chicago landing the No. 1 overall pick for next summer, let's see how the start of the first round could go down.

title: How each of the 12 College Football Playoff teams could win the national title
content: Bill Connelly breaks down the path to victory for every team -- and what will hold each of them back.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea and Real Madrid eye Nottingham Forest's Murillo
content: Real Madrid and Chelsea are monitoring Nottingham Forest defender Murillo. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: NBA Futures: Thunder remain championship favorites ahead of Nuggets, Rockets
content: The Oklahoma City Thunder are favorites to repeat as champions, with Denver and Houston next in line.

title: Early Week 15 bets: Patriots over Bills, Lions to cover in shootout with Rams
content: What lines offered value once odds came out? Here are five games we're eyeing for bets going into Week 15.

title: Navy Chief in Brazil to strengthen India Brazil defence cooperation
content: Admiral Tripathi holds high-level meetings in Brasilia to deepen defence partnership and maritime security cooperation

title: Existing labour courts, industrial tribunals to continue till new ones formed: Govt to Delhi HC
content: The Bench had said it appeared that prima facie, the provisions permitting smooth transition for the new labour code have not been thought of by the central government; as a result, the labour disputes remain unattended, which might have arisen on or before November 21.

title: Nellore Collector ranks second in clearance of files in A.P.
content: Krishna District Collector stands first in the clearing of e-files in three months, while Vizianagaram District Collector emerges third in the State

title: Bids received for Kasaragod water aerodrome project during UDAN 5.5 bidding
content: Letter of Intent issued for seaplane operations on routes connecting Kasaragod with Mangaluru and Kannur airports, Union Civil Aviation Minister informs Parliament

title: Coast Guard intercepts Pakistani vessel inside India‚Äôs EEZ; 11 detained for illegal entry
content: The apprehended fishermen were transferred to Jakhau Marine police station in Gujarat for further inquiry

title: Sixth edition of Kochi-Muziris Biennale opens on Friday
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan will formally inaugurate the international exhibition at Parade Ground in the evening. The exhibition features works by 66 artists/collectives from 25 countries, alongside a range of parallel shows

title: BLO deployed for SIR in Rajasthan dies after collapsing; postmortem to ascertain cause of death
content: There was no pressure on him and no notice issued to him, Sub-Divisional Magistrate said after Vijay Gurjar died

title: Vajpayee‚Äôs leadership a benchmark for good governance, says Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav
content: Highlighting the former Prime Minister‚Äôs contributions in telecom reforms, rural road connectivity, nuclear tests and welfare programmes, he says that these helped shape modern India

title: Who is Justice G.R. Swaminathan? | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: Who is Justice Swaminathan, what drives his decisions, and why are 107 MPs from the INDIA bloc seeking his impeachment?

title: Bihar Minister urges Centre to release pending ‚Çπ7,748.49 crore under PMAY-G, MGNREGA
content: According to a statement issued by the state Rural Development Department, under the material head of MGNREGA, liabilities totalling ‚Çπ3,257.49 crore (including dues for FY 2025-26) remain unpaid

title: Goa nightclub fire case: Delhi court dismisses Luthra brothers' transit anticipatory bail pleas
content: During the proceedings, counsel for the State of Goa opposed the pleas, saying, ‚ÄúThey left, they concealed, and they are now seeking leniency‚Äù

title: Strengthen TDP at booth level, Chandrababu Naidu tells mandal presidents
content: Play an active role in implementation of welfare schemes and ensure the party earns the trust of women, he advises party leaders

title: Study shows community-based model can improve secondary prevention of stroke
content: The study showed that even in resource-constrained settings, a coordinated CHW-led model, using Kerala‚Äôs existing health workforce, can strengthen continuity of care and improve secondary stroke prevention among stroke survivors living in the community.

title: Crisis-Hit IndiGo India's Only Major Profitable Airline: Centre In Lok Sabha
content: As passengers continue to grapple with flight cancellations and delays triggered by IndiGo's operational meltdown, government data tabled in the Lok Sabha on Thursday has underscored a harsh reality: India's aviation sector is largely loss-making.

title: US To Reject Tourist Visa If Applicant Plans To Give Birth During Stay
content: People who file tourist applications to visit the US with an intention to game the American system won't have it easy, according to the US embassy in India.

title: Over Rs 47 Crore Spent For Siddaramaiah's Chartered Flight Travels
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's use of chartered aircraft and helicopters has cost the state government more than Rs 47 crore between May 2023 and November 2025, according to official records placed before the Legislative Council.

title: Former Pak Spy Chief Sentenced To 14 Years For State Secret Violations
content: The former head of Pakistan's spy agency was sentenced to 14 years in prison for violating state secrets and abusing his authority, the army said on Thursday.

title: Mexico Slaps 50% Tariffs On India. $1 Billion Exports In Crosshairs
content: Four months after the US imposed 50 per cent tariffs on India for most goods, Mexico has approved levies of up to 50 per cent on the import of select products from Asian countries, including from India and China.

title: Explained: Main Parties And Issues In February's Bangladesh Election
content: Bangladesh is set to hold a national election in February, its first since a student-led uprising toppled long-time leader Sheikh Hasina in August 2024. Her Awami League, the South Asian nation's largest party, has been barred from contesting.

title: IndiGo Processes Refunds For All Cancelled Flights, CEO Meets Regulator
content: IndiGo Chief Executive Officer Pieter Elbers arrived at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Thursday for a meeting, amid the airline's ongoing efforts to address customer grievances and operational disruptions.

title: Nationwide Raids Uncover ISIS-Linked Radicalisation, Illicit Funding Network
content: The searches were carried out at premises linked to the accused individuals, their close associates, family members, and entities showing dubious financial connections or suspicious monetary transactions.

title: Ex-Miss Switzerland Finalist Chopped, Pureed; Husband Charged With Murder
content: The husband of a former Miss Switzerland finalist has been charged with her murder, Swiss authorities announced Wednesday.

title: India Sets Own Air Quality Standards, Global Rankings Not Official: Centre
content: The Ministry clarified that it has notified National Ambient Air Quality Standards for 12 pollutants in 2009 to protect public health and the environment, and these standards are tailored to India's specific conditions.

title: After "Brahmin Women" Comment, IAS Officer's Remarks On SC/ST Judges Sparks Row
content: Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer Santosh Verma, whose comment on Brahmin women led to outrage, has created another storm with his allegation that the high court stopped Scheduled Tribes (ST) candidates from becoming civil judges.

title: 'Dharmendra A Patriot, Had A Clean And Pure Heart': Amit Shah At Prayer Meet
content: Terming the death of superstar Dharmendra a great loss, Home Minister Amit Shah has said the actor was so versatile that he could play characters like Veeru in 'Sholay' and Parimal Tripathi in the romantic comedy 'Chupke Chupke'.

title: Bengaluru's Big Move For Those Waiting For Passengers At Arrival Terminal
content: Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport is set to roll out new arrival pick-up regulations aimed at easing congestion, improving safety, and ensuring smoother passenger movement outside its terminals.

title: Thousands Face Evacuations As New Round Of Heavy Rain Threatens Washington
content: Tens of thousands of residents in western Washington could face evacuation orders when another round of heavy rain drops on the region Thursday, threatening to bring catastrophic flooding as rivers near historic levels.

title: Umar Khalid Granted Interim Bail By Delhi Court To Attend Sister's Wedding
content: A Delhi court on Thursday granted interim bail from December 16 to 29 to former JNU student Umar Khalid to attend his sister's wedding.

title: Opinion: Blog | The Real Ikkis Story: The 21-Year-Old Who Kept Pak Away From Jammu In 1971
content: Khetarpal denied the Pakistan Army a vital breakthrough on December 17, 1971, on India's western border, and kept them from gaining control of the road to Jammu. Indira Gandhi wrote a heartfelt letter to his father, honouring his bravery.

title: Goa Club Fire LIVE Updates: Court Denies Bail To Luthra Brothers
content: Goa Nightclub Fire Tragedy LIVE News Updates: Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, who fled India following a fire at their nightclub in Goa that killed 25 people, were detained on Thursday morning.

title: Rahul Gandhi's Claims On Representation In Constitutional Bodies Untrue: Sources
content: Countering an assertion by Rahul Gandhi that there was a "systematic pattern" of excluding marginalised communities from appointments to Constitutional and autonomous institutions, government sources on Thursday pointed to the UPA government's track.

title: Vande Mataram Should Be Accorded Same Status As National Anthem: JP Nadda
content: BJP President J P Nadda on Thursday asserted in the Rajya Sabha that the national song Vande Mataram is linked to "nationalism" and the country should take a resolve to accord equal status to it as is given to the national anthem and flag.

title: Animal Trafficking Reaches Record High In 2025: Interpol
content: Interpol said that wildlife crime is now an industry worth more than $20 billion a year, ranging from the movement of thousands of shark fins to banned ivory and primate meat.

title: Guwahati inferno remains uncontrolled for over 38 hours; multiple agencies called in
content: The authorities concerned did not enforce required safety norms while permitting a commercial structure of this size, officials said

title: Two criminals externed from Kurnool district
content: Both have been involved in more than 15 criminal cases each and jailed, but did not mend their ways after coming out of prison

title: Goa nightclub fire case: Luthra brothers to be brought back at the earliest, says CM Sawant
content: A local panchayat official will also be arrested in the fire case as he was not cooperating with the probe, CM Pramod Sawant added

title: NK districts continue to be in list of backward districts :Arvind Bellad
content: Deputy Leader of Opposition in the Legislative Assembly Arvind Bellad has said that despite claims of redressing the regional imbalance by successive governments, the districts of North Karnataka continue to remain in the list of most backward districts in the State

title: Prada to source collection of sandals, inspired by Kolhapuri Chappals from LIDCOM, LIDKAR
content: Earlier in June this year, Prada faced criticism for leather sandals in its Spring/Summer 2026 collection, which closely resembled Kolhapuri Chappal

title: Congress slams APERC move to increase tariffs in Andhra Pradesh
content: The proposal to impose an additional burden of ‚Çπ15,651 crore contradicts the Chief Minister‚Äôs election promise of not increasing power charges, says APCC chief Sharmila

title: Two new jumping spider species recorded in Meghalaya
content: ZSI scientists document Asemonea dentis and Colyttus nongwar, widening the jumping spider diversity in the north-eastern region

title: NHAI to conduct intensive soil testing across 378 RS wall locations in Kerala
content: Eighteen geotechnical agencies will perform soil sampling and testing across 18 highway projects in Kerala. Move follows the collapse of a portion of a wall on the NH-66 at Mylakkadu in Kollam. Reports generated after proper investigations will serve as the basis for re-checking the construction of every single RS wall, says NHAI

title: BEML rolls out prototype of new driver-less metro train set for Bengaluru‚Äôs Phase-2 metro network
content: The highly anticipated pink line corridor is expected to open in two stages by the end of 2026, connecting Kalena Agrahara to Nagawara.

title: Watch: Indian rice exporters not worried about US‚Äôs high tariff threats
content: Indian rice exporters remain unfazed after the United States threatened to impose higher tariffs on Indian rice. Exporters say the move is unlikely to affect their business, as shipments to the US make up only a tiny fraction of India‚Äôs overall rice exports. However, rice growers in Haryana feel that higher tariff by US would make them competitive weaker in the global market at a time when farmers in any case were facing a lot of problems.

title: Protests in Nagaland over Citizenship Amendment Act
content: NESO secretary general Mutsikhoyo Yhobu said the students' bodies had opposed the law since its inception

title: Delhi court grants interim bail to Umar Khalid to attend sister's wedding
content: ‚ÄúDuring the interim bail period, the applicant (Khalid) shall not use the social media,‚Äù the court said, directing him to ‚Äúonly meet his family members, relatives and friends‚Äù

title: Conspiracy to dismantle public institutions detrimental to India's future: Rahul Gandhi
content: Mr. Gandhi, the Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha, shared a video of his conversation with employees of a PSU, Bharat Immunologicals and Biologicals Corporation Limited (BIBCOL) at his Parliament office, saying they had not received salaries for some time now

title: Rape accused Kerala MLA Rahul¬†Mamkootathil  turns up for voting in Palakkad two weeks since going into hiding
content: CPI(M) workers heckled the Palakkad MLA and raised slogans against him. A strong police force was deployed near the polling station anticipating Rahul Mamkootathil‚Äôs arrival

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: Newly elected members to take oath on December 21
content: State Election Commission has scheduled the counting of votes polled in the two-phased  local body polls for December 13

title: Three killed as speeding car flips over NH 44 median, crashes into KSRTC bus near Bengaluru
content: The police suspect the car was being driven at a high speed, causing the driver to lose control. The car reportedly skidded for nearly 100 feet before leaping over the median into the opposite lane.

title: Pallikaranai marshland ‚Äòground truthing‚Äô exercise completed, Advocate General informs Madras HC
content: He says that the report has now been sent to the Chengalpattu Collectorate for authentication and thereafter, it would be submitted before the Supreme Court in the third week of January

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: Congress candidates attacked in Kannur
content: In two separate incidents, UDF‚Äôs two women candidates as well as a polling agent were attacked allegedly by CPI(M) workers

title: Two Odisha Ministers visit Malkangiri; administration extends internet ban by another 12 hours

title: Telangana focuses on transition of high interest microfinance to smart finance systems
content: Repayment history will be one of the focal points to transform SHGs and JLGs as gateways for individual credit

title: Sukhu marks three years in office, cites systemic reforms; slams BJP-led Centre for indifference towards Himachal
content: Himachal CM highlights systemic reforms, disaster relief delays, and fiscal pressures in interview with The Hindu

title: Hydrogen Fuel Cell EVs transformative to shape India's clean future: Pralhad Joshi
content: Pralhad Joshi drove a hydrogen fuel cell electric car, Mirai, manufactured by Japanese automaker Toyota, to the Parliament to showcase advanced hydrogen mobility

title: SIR of electoral rolls: Election Commission extends timeline in five States and Andaman and Nicobar; no change in West Bengal
content: In Kerala, the last date for submission of enumeration form will be December 18, 2025, and the draft roll will be published on December 23, 2025

title: Mamata Banerjee slams Amit Shah as 'dangerous', warns of dharnas if any eligible voter is deleted from list during SIR
content: Accusing the Centre of targeting Bengalis, CM Mamata Banerjee said, ‚ÄúWe have a [Union] Home Minister who can do anything to label all Bengalis as Bangladeshis and send them to detention camps.‚Äù

title: Delhi pollution: Congress MP Tagore in Lok Sabha demands Beijing-style plan
content: Manickam Tagore said China's capital Beijing was more polluted than Delhi a few years back, but it took steps by fixing strict deadlines and accountability

title: At least 18 from Assam killed, three others missing as truck falls into gorge in Arunachal
content: Tinsukia Senior Superintendent of Police Mayank Kumar said that 22 labourers from the district had gone to Arunachal Pradesh for the construction of a hostel

title: TVK forms panels for negotiating seat-sharing talks, drafting election manifesto

title: Committee set up to review extent of deemed forest in Karnataka, to submit report within 6 months: Minister Eshwar Khandre
content: The Minister cited confusion over the extent of deemed forest in Karnataka and the problems being faced by farmers

title: Locals oppose establishment of steel plant in Gurla mandal of Vizianagaram
content: Andhra Government allocated 1,085 acres land to Super Smelters Limited for the establishment of a green field steel plant with an estimated cost of ‚Çπ8,570 crore

title: Kerala local body polls: Palakkad hits 60% polling by 2.30 p.m.

title: Environment Ministry allows preparation of ToR for seven water aerodromes in Andhra Pradesh

title: Debate on Vande Mataram only to set the record straight, says J.P. Nadda

title: Kerala local body polls: a swift start, half of Malappuram cast their votes in first six hours

title: Don't turn Liverpool chaos into Slot vs. Salah: Club bosses must step in

title: Rankings for Week 15
content:
Tristan H. Cockcroft explains what makes Joe Burrow a great quarterback option for the remainder of the fantasy season. (1:06) ESPN's weekly PPR and IDP  fantasy football  rankings are an aggregate of our rankers (eight PPR, three IDP). They are Matt Bowen, Mike Clay, Tristan H. Cockcroft, Daniel Dopp, Eric Karabell, Liz Loza, Eric Moody and Field Yates. Karabell also provides his superflex rankings all season long. Rankings will be published every Tuesday and are updated throughout the week for news and emerging analysis. PPR rankings:

title: Ten (maybe 11) players to watch at NCAA volleyball tournament's Sweet 16
content: the 2025 NCAA volleyball tournament is down to its final 16 teams . can Nebraska, the no. 1 overall seed, finish undefeated and claim the program's sixth national title? will Kentucky return to the final four for the first time since winning its first national championship in 2020?
